lines.text: If brains were leather, Philo Sandine couldn't saddle a bug.
My people have a saying which sums it up rather nicely... Hawk-a-hey.
Hawk-a-hey?
It's a good day to die. Adios, pilgrim.
I was worried you wouldn't make it, Maverick.
Well, Bass, now you can start worrying that I did.
[Bass robs Maverick]
You make your deposit, Maverick, and I'll make my withdraw.
Boy, it's getting bad when you have to con your own horse for a ride.
when you save a life, you own that life. I am your servant. I am your brother.
I already have a brother and I don't want a servant... particularly some bogus Indian who thinks he's Sitting Bull!
Standing Bear! And my life belong to you.
I don't want it!
You got it, pilgrim!
Pay no attention to Sheriff Guthrie. He's just a little bit bitter because he's about to become a footnote in Sweetwater's past.
Well, there's no law against buying votes. Some of the folks around here need the money more than they need the choice. That's just the way it's done now. Now if you'll excuse me...
Well, M.L. says you should give longer speeches.

So she has told me more than once. Speech-making and hand-shaking don't have anything to do with being a good sheriff. When I came to this town, they didn't even have elections. I ran off the Bannavich Gang and they hired me. It was as simple as that. Now a man has to kiss babies... among other things.
You know, the worse thing about a reputation is you can't outrun the thing. The press never lets up. They're on a body like stink on a dead man.
Some people have no shame.
lines.character: Mary Lou Springer, Publisher Sweetwater Territorian

lines.text: That's because others have enough for everybody.
[Bret and Mary Lou are trapped in a cross-fire]
Well, they got us pinned flater than a brown tick on a white dog.
[Mary Lou follows Bret and Tom to the showdown]
What's she doing out there?
I made the mistake of telling her she couldn't come.
[first lines]
It's him. It's him! M.L. M.L. M.L.!
[last lines]
[M.L. tries to take a picture of Maverick and his friends underneath the ranch's new sign]
Come on, Bret, get into the spirit of things. Smile!
lines.character: Mary Lou Springer, Publisher Sweetwater Territorian

lines.text: [in the next shot, Mary Lou discovers Maverick hid his face behind a shovel]
Damn!
lines.character: Mary Lou Springer, Publisher Sweetwater Territorian

lines.text: For a man who hates violence, you came pretty well heeled.
With Ramsey Bass around, I don't want more of that violence happening to me.
Besides, if I go ridin' off with him on some lost cause, who's to keep 'em from stuffin' the ballot box with votes for Dowd? I gotta stay in town, M.L., to protect my job.
I thought your job was protecting people!
lines.character: Mary Lou Springer, Publisher Sweetwater Territorian

lines.text: Pappy always told me to stay clear of men who promise no regrets and here I am throwin' a rope to one.
As my old pappy used to say, "It's a wise coyote that lets a rabbit run into his mouth" and I think Sweetwater's got room for this old coyote.
